channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [SERVER-79445] Consider upgrading PCRE2
item.description: We currently use PCRE2 version 10.40. The most recent version is 10.42. We should consider upgrading.
item.summary: Consider upgrading PCRE2

item.title: [SERVER-79444] Upgrade dcleblanc/SafeInt
item.description: We have vendored SafeInt version 3.0.26. At the time of writing, the current version is 3.0.28a. We should consider upgrading.
item.summary: Upgrade dcleblanc/SafeInt

item.title: [SERVER-79443] Fix legacy shell crash if an auto-encryption function is called on closed Mongo connection
item.description: SERVER-77600 added the ability to set and toggle auto-encryption on an existing Mongo connection. This added new functions to the Mongo object namely: set/unsetAutoEncryption(), toggleAutoEncryption(), isAutoEncryptionEnabled(), and getAutoEncryptionOptions().  If these functions are called after the connection was closed, it results in a segmentation fault, since these functions do not check the private data shared pointer before dereferencing it.  The proper behavior is to throw an exception.
item.summary: Fix legacy shell crash if an auto-encryption function is called on closed Mongo connection

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

item.title: [EVG-20538] Tag negation in local aliases not working with evergreen cli
item.description:
When defining a local alias with a variant or task tag value that includes a negative tag (preceeded by a !), it does not seem to be selecting the proper tasks when a patch is created.

Given the following project definition in the .evergreen.yml file:

projects:
 
    - name: realm-core-stable
 
      trigger_aliases: []
 
      local_aliases:
 
        - alias: nightly_tests
 
          description: "Realm Core Nightly Tests"
 
          variant: ".*"
 
          task: ".*"
 
        - alias: pr_tests
 
          description: "Realm Core PR Tests"
 
          variant: ".*"
 
          task_tags: 
          - for_pull_requests
 
        - alias: commit_tests
 
          description: "Realm Core Commit Tests"
 
          variant: ".*"
 
          task_tags: [ "!cron_tests" ]

And running the evergreen CLI (version 2023-07-25) produces the following output and creates a patch, but none of the tasks are selected:

evergreen patch -p realm-core-stable -a commit_tests -u
 
Set [.!cron_tests] as the default tasks for project 'realm-core-stable'? (y/N) n
 
Enter a description for this patch (optional): testing patch aliases - commit
 
 evergreen/config.yml | 22 ++++++++++++++++++++--
 
 1 file changed, 20 insertions(+), 2 deletions(-)
 
a814e89e6 Run objstore tests on ubuntu2204
 
b80480f8b Added patch alias definitions to evergreen config.yml
 
This is a summary of the patch to be submitted. Continue? (Y/n) y
 
Patch successfully created.
 
 
 
         ID : 64c2db472fbabe87e280dddc
 
    Created : 2023-07-27 21:02:01.528 +0000 UTC
 
    Description : testing patch aliases - commit
 
      Build : https://evergreen.mongodb.com/patch/64c2db472fbabe87e280dddc?redirect_spruce_users=true
 
     Status : created

This issue may be due to the fact that the evergreen CLI is converting the [ "!cron_tests" ] to [ ".!cron_tests" ], which is not the proper negative tag format of [ "!.cron_tests" ] per the documentation.

Creating a patch with the pr_tests or nightly_tests local alias works fine.
item.summary: Tag negation in local aliases not working with evergreen cli

item.title: [DOCS-16281] Add changelog, release notes for 6.0.9-rc0
item.summary: Add changelog, release notes for 6.0.9-rc0

item.title: [SERVER-79442] Update command may send mirrored reads without filter, hint or collation
item.description:
Currently update command only sets _updateOpObj when the `updates` DocumentSequence is present in OpMsg. However this is often not the case, especially due to SERVER-77648 which means that all update commands sent from mongos to mongod are serialized in a way that does not have any DocumentSequence in OpMsg (this can be verified by doing a simple update through mongos in a sharded cluster).
 
Without correctly setting _updateOpObj, the mirrored read requests sent to secondaries will not have filter, hint or collation, and this means that the documents we put into secondary's cache will not be the same as user read on primary. This might have negative impact on the effectiveness of cache warmup.
item.summary: Update command may send mirrored reads without filter, hint or collation

comments.comment:
A couple of point from the offline discussion with Amirsaman Memaripour:

  • Even with this problem, we might still have enough in WiredTiger cache to have a smooth transition after the election (e.g., the top levels of the B-Tree for the collection will end up being in the cache anyway)
  • We never measured the effectiveness of mirror reads, this needs more product discussion.

cc Shameek Ray

Moreover SERVER-77648 talks about the case that a update command can be serialized to OpMsg without having DocumentSequence when the command is sent from mongos, however it seems that this can even happen in a replica set, this might need separate investigation.

item.title: [EVG-20537] Allow setting environment variables to host.create provider: docker
item.description:
We want to pass Environment variables to a new host.create provider: docker

Related to: https://jira.mongodb.org/browse/EVG-20463
item.summary: Allow setting environment variables to host.create provider: docker

item.title: [CSHARP-4734] Throw an exception when an aggregation style projection is used with Find on servers prior to 4.4
item.description: Currently when an aggregation style projection is executed with Find against a server prior to 4.4 the server silently returns the wrong results. Since silently returning the wrong results is bad, we can detect that an attempt is being made to use an aggregation style projection with a server that doesn't support that and throw an exception instead.
item.summary: Throw an exception when an aggregation style projection is used with Find on servers prior to 4.4

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

item.title: [SERVER-79441] Move mongotmock tests into shared folder for both $vectorSearch and $search
item.description:
There are a few common tests in jstests/search and jstests/vector_search that are focusing more on mongotmock itself. The only difference is the way to trigger the tests (either via $search or $vectorSearch).

A way to organize the tests is to move them to a shared folder.
item.summary: Move mongotmock tests into shared folder for both $vectorSearch and $search

item.title: [SERVER-79440] Reduce duplicate code for setting mongot mock responses for $vectorSearch
item.description:
Refactor the jstests to reduce the duplicate code in the jstests. For example, in jstests/vector_search/vector_search_auth_required.js, there's a function testSimpleVectorSearchQuery to be moved into utils.

  1. set up mongod/a cluster + mongot in some configuration
  2. set up basic mongot response
  3. run basic $vectorSearch query, make sure results are expected
item.summary: Reduce duplicate code for setting mongot mock responses for $vectorSearch

item.title: [PYTHON-3889] Implement Load Balancing for GitHub PR Reviews
item.description: This will enable us to automatically share PR review duties.
item.summary: Implement Load Balancing for GitHub PR Reviews

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

item.title: [TOOLS-3358] Investigate changes in SERVER-57297: Support OP_MSG exhaust cursors on mongos
item.description:
Original Downstream Change Summary

mongos supports exhaust cursors. This change implements exhaust cursors for mongos when a client's getMore request has exhaustAllowed flag set.

Description of Linked Ticket

SERVER-36105 added support for OP_MSG exhaust cursors for both mongod and mongos in 4.2. Later in SERVER-44517 support for exhaust on mongos was removed in 4.4 (for the good reason that the mongos code path was untested). This ticket request that OP_MSG exhaust cursors be officially supported on mongos.

DRIVERS-535 depends on this feature since we don't want to add a feature to drivers which doesn't work in sharded clusters. The motivation is that exhaust cursors can provide better query performance.

Another potential improvement is for Load Balanced clusters. When the driver is connected through a load balancer it automatically pins the connection to the cursor. Since the connection is already pinned, it would be possible to automatically use exhaust cursors to (potentially) improve performance.
item.summary: Investigate changes in SERVER-57297: Support OP_MSG exhaust cursors on mongos
item.reporter: Backlog - Core Eng Program Management Team

item.title: [SERVER-79435] [CQF] Improve common subexpression elimination to remove duplicate projection of nested field
item.description:
For the query, 

find({"a.b.c": 1, "a.b.d": 1})

where there are non-multikey indexes on "a'" and "a.b", Bonsai might produce the following plan

Root [{p0}]
 
Filter []
 
|   EvalFilter []
 
|   |   Variable [p10]
 
|   PathGet [b] PathGet [d] PathTraverse [1] PathCompare [Eq] Const [1]
 
Filter []
 
|   EvalFilter []
 
|   |   Variable [p10]
 
|   PathGet [b] PathGet [c] PathTraverse [1] PathCompare [Eq] Const [1]
 
PhysicalScan [{'<root>': p0, 'a': p10}, c_8c978cf6-00f0-457e-baa4-a76eba34bbb6]
 
 
 
 
 
[2] filter {(traverseF(getField(getField(s3, "b"), "d"), lambda(l101.0) { (move(l101.0) == 1L) }, false) ?: false)}
 
[1] filter {(traverseF(getField(getField(s3, "b"), "c"), lambda(l101.0) { (move(l101.0) == 1L) }, false) ?: false)}
 
[0] scan s2 none none none none none none none lowPriority [s3 = a] @"8c978cf6-00f0-457e-baa4-a76eba34bbb6" true false

Note that the projection for "a" is shared between the two filter nodes as it is pushed down to the physical scan, but the projection for "a.b" is re-evaluated, once by each Filter node.

This plan could be improved by avoiding the duplicate getField("b") by inserting an EvaluationNode between the PhysicalScan and Filter to generate this projection. I think we should run such a rewrite after the memo phases.

Part of this ticket should also be to understand why the existing path fusion rewrites don't handle this case.
item.summary: [CQF] Improve common subexpression elimination to remove duplicate projection of nested field
